page.title: 13The Headmaster - 2
page.content: To make{Poulner}a better place, Mr. Russell says he would particularly like more recreation land. Given proper supervision, this school's extensive playing fields might also be opened to the public. This might help to combat{vandalism}and stop{illegal {entry} and give young people what they need. Poulner School used to have no vandalism whatsoever, but nowadays they suffer vandalism approximately every two weeks. Earlier this very week the swimming pool was vandalised, also many windows get broken and even the roofs are damaged. "Poulner," says Mr.Russell, "cannot expand much more. The land to the north is being turned into lakes by gravel extraction{no building}must {ever}be allowed to the east within{ the{New Forest."}
